cells.data:
1.DNS

DNS, which stands for domain name system, controls your domain name's website and email settings. When visitors go to your domain name, its DNS settings control which company's server it reaches out to.

For example, if you use GoDaddy's DNS settings, visitors will reach GoDaddy's servers when using your domain name. If you change those settings to another company, visitors will reach that company when they use your domain name.



2.A CDN, or Content Delivery Network, is a means of distribution that  both large-scale and small-scale websites incorporate into their website’s data transfer structure. 

This technology allows content, usually website files, to be replicated on various data centers around the world. It’s a means of caching files close to the visitor’s physical location.


 For example, when a visitor from China accesses a website hosted in the United States, there is a certain amount of latency incurred because of the distance between the networks. 

However, a CDN would first check to see if the file being accessed was already stored on a data center close to the visitor.

(1) If the file was found, it would be transferred from the nearest location and greatly reduce any network latency.

(2) In case the file was not found, it would be sent from the main server to a data center, ideally, in China.

(3) When another visitor from China accesses the site, the file would then be found on a data center near them and be delivered much faster.


2

1. most interesting problem you solved; 

Let me think, I think the most interesting problem I solved is one of  a algorithm problem, which call dungeon game,
In this algorithm problem, The demons had captured the princess  and imprisoned her in the bottom-right corner of a dungeon, and the dungeon is a 2D matrix, and our task goal is find a way from top-left matrix to  through the dungeon to rescue the princess. I spend a long time to think how to solved this problem from a programming view, , and finally I I use dynamic programming algorithm to tackle  this problem.Since this problem give me a feeling I was like really solve the realistic world thing, so I thinkg it’s pretty interesting.

2. mistake you made before; 
I think the worst mistake I ever made at work was in my first internship, I was given a project to complete in a week.  I understood the project, but I misinterpreted one section.  After completing the project, I was told by my manager that it was done incorrectly.  I really made a mistake by assuming incorrectly in one of the sections instead of asking for clarification.  From this mistake, I learned not to assume through the mistake I made."

3. how do you handle relationship with colleagues
At first  communicate effectively is very important because I think the foundation of every good relationship is solid communication. we also need  to know our co-worker.Since one of the best ways to build positive relationships is to make time to learn about people.We should Be reliable and have a positive attitude, sometimes we need to Cope with conflict. That’s  how I usuallly handle relationship with colleagues

5.How do you feel about working nights and weekends?
I am a fresher so I would like to have much experience so I would like to work in night shifts and weekends. Company growth is my growth. So I like to work in any situation.

5. Do you know wayfair?
CloudFlare can protects and accelerates any website online,for example, like using CDN technology to speed up the website, also protect the website from a range of online threats like sql injection and dos attack.

6. Why do you want to work at CloudFlare?
You know, CloudFlare is one of the good growing high-tech companies. As a fresher every one wish to join in such reputed company in order to improve their practical knowledge. According to my view CloudFlare provides a great opportunity for me in order to gain practical knowledge and good environment.I am truly passionate about the work CloudFlare provide.So that’s why I want to join  CloudFlare 
.

7. why do you chose the position?
You know I am have many years experience in software development field,so I love coding and problem solving, I  have a passion for breaking things and putting them back together, and I also want to be a  full-stack web developer, above all is pretty according with this position’s requirement, and I really want to work for wayfair, that’s why I chose this position

• What is the best part of working for CloudFlare?
  • What are the biggest challenges of this job?
  • what type of background do you feel would be best suited for this position?
  • What do you think about Boston?
  • What is the interview process

1. Self-introduction

My name is  Zhengbin and you can call me Robin, I am from China, I have done my bachelor degree computer science and previous master degree information security in beijing jiaotong university. Now I am  a graduate student from Santa clara university, majored in computer science and engineering. My currently concentration is web development, and I am also solid in Java programming.I wanna be a full-stack developer in the future.

What’s more, I am self-motivated and enjoy working in a team environment. I am also a hard worker and quick learner .I’m looking for an opportunity to work for a growing company where I can contribute my hands-on experience and grow my career with the company. Thank you for giving me this interview opportunity.

2. About project 

1. Vending Machine Project is  the most impressive project I’va ever done

I developed a Vending Machine backend Web Site. It’s a online vending machine system, which has two main part, the first part which  we used a android app to act as a vending machine, we can buy item from the app.

The second part is a backend website, that is what I do,It is used to allow employee to register and login, including the CRUD operation. Employees work on each vending machine to register the machine, add or delete item from machine and refill machine when it needed.  The Monitoring website is also able to get all the statistics, including items, machine and sales information.

The fronted end use bootstrap jQuery and ejs template,The backend is written in a Nodejs,and using node framework expressjs 

The difficult part is the integration part since there are a lot of modules working together. For example ,the backend website, the frontend android client and the java communication server.To conquer it, I read a lot of helper document and talk with my group member for many times.You know I am totally new to Nodejs,and  few people in our team have experience in it,  the other difficult part would be asynchronous programming. What I am  probably used to is writing a recipe that the computer executes in the order you instruct it. That's simply not how asynchronous code works; it can execute differently each time depending on how long a request takes, how big a file being read is, etc.So how to adapt to asynchronous programming is also a difficult part

2.PetBnB Website

This online websit used to assist people with finding pet sitters when in need.

 My responsibility is mainly focusing on  implemented the  front-end design include a pet-hoster detailed page,the fronted end use angular.js framework, it is used to showing result lists with Google Map API. For example when we search some kinds of dogs, then the google map will show some pets which meet the requirement, when you click the icon on the map, then will jump to a details page, and you can see a pet list, it provide the dogs’ information hoster information, price, and so on.And you can filter the result by different condition,like distance, price, star.

The difficult part:

One difficult part is how to using Google Map API in angularjs, I am just a new angular learner at that time, the google maps directive just show one markers, I try many time and figure out this problem.The other difficult part is When I need to implement a evaluate functionality, which the user can evaluate the service from 1 to 5 star,so I need to custom a angular.js directive. You need to consider the restrict property and how to write the template and how to connect with the controller. So all of those thing I think it’s most difffcult part  in this project.


3. Weather Web Application 

This is a simple web application, which is used to show the weather of some cities in a week, at first we just complete a static page which can only  show one city’s weather, the UI was mocked-up the iphone’s weather app.And then we Implemented by using Ember.js and AJAX in order to achieve functions of search cites as well as add any delete any city.

The most difficult part is when we need to implement the function of add or delete any city, we need to know use AJAX to get the weather data from the weather api, this pretty confused me at that time.


4.Frugal Innovation Lab Application Class Project

This project is a  management system would be used by students, faculty members, and staff who are undertaking the initiation of a project. 

The application will allow for team members to create timelines (with dependencies), delegate tasks to a particular member, generate and track budgets, record communications with partners, etc. The aim of this application is to assist with the execution of successful projects.

I think the most difficult part is to implement the visual timeline of project,which is  deliverables with inputs for specific dates and the flexibility to visually scale


3.About work

1.Beijing Jiaotong University

In this work, I am a student research assistant  ,you konw my major is information security and the work is more relate to security field. during that time, I am  focusing on the existing remote authentication scheme based on biological characteristics, like finger print and palmprint. At my work I also analyzed the safety defects of different biometirc security system, then design and develop  a new blind identity authentication scheme based on palmprintso what is blind authentication? which is means A biometric authentication protocol that does not reveal any information about the biometric samples to the authenticating server.

At the initial, we used matlab to  simulate the authentication scheme, and then used Java to implement the scheme. The scheme can effectively solve issues on user privacy, template protection and intentity trust. 

2. NEC Software Technology  

In this work, I am a Software Engineer Intern, involved the development of  a web application for the backend trading system. The services that back-end systems provide include risk management, order management, execution management, exchange connectivity, authentication and entitlements, and market data distribution. But  you know, I am just a intern, so I only pariticipate to the order management part.Using this order management system, user can sign in and then look up and order services. They can also search, cancel, and suspend their orders. The system is using the Spring Struts and hibernate framework.

You know for me, most code is based of some previous code. The moset difficult part to me is reading and understanding somebody else's code especially when they don't comment things .

0. What are your biggest challenges as a front-end web developer?

    1. Coding Javascript in a robust way. Backend software is evolved like PHP and Java ,they are relatively easy to create good, maintainable code there by using MVC and mature CMS's. With Javascript, I wouldn't say that it's as easy, You need to put more effort into making sure all Javascript is working in all browsers and that new code is written and placed in a maintainable way.
    2. Cross Browser Support. For ex.Chrome supports input type number ,while firefox has not yet implemented it.
     3. Layout Engine Softwares are different for different browsers. Ex.webkit(chrome),Gecko(firefox).
     4. Client Window sizes,your UI should be intact for all Screen Resolutions.
     5. Having to learn new and complex topics. Just recently, with the trend of Responsive Web Design, LESS & SASS CSS preprocessors and much more, it's become harder for the beginners to keep up.

2.Difference between UDP and TCP  
TCP is connection oriented – once a connection is established, data can be sent bidirectional. UDP is a simpler, connectionless Internet protocol. 

3.Singleton
the singleton pattern is a design pattern that restricts the instantiation of a class to one object. 
This is useful when exactly one object is needed to coordinate actions across the system. 

A mutex provides mutual exclusion, either producer or consumer can have the key (mutex) and proceed with their work. As long as the buffer is filled by producer, the consumer needs to wait, and vice versa
A semaphore is a generalized mutex.
